What is the atomic number of Sodium (Na)?
What is the group number of Chlorine (Cl) in the periodic table?

Stoichiometry.question: How many moles are in 32 grams of Oxygen (O2)?
What is the molar mass of NaCl?
How many grams are in 2 moles of H2O?

The Diversity of Matter and Chemical Bon.question: Which of the following bonds is ionic?
In which type of bond are electrons shared?
What is the bond angle in a molecule with a tetrahedral shape?
Which of the following is a characteristic of ionic compounds?
Which of the following is an example of an intermolecular force?
Which type of force holds atoms together within a molecule?
Which of the following compounds contains only covalent bonds?
What type of bond exists between two nonmetal atoms with a small electronegativity difference?
Which of the following correctly differentiates between intermolecular and intramolecular forces?
options: Intermolecular forces exist within a molecule, while intramolecular forces exist between molecules
Intramolecular forces exist within a molecule, while intermolecular forces exist between molecules
Intramolecular forces are weaker than intermolecular forces
The Diversity of Matter and Chemical Bon.answer: Intramolecular forces exist within a molecule, while intermolecular forces exist between molecules

The Diversity of Matter and Chemical Bon.question: Which of the following best describes an isotope?
options: A compound with the same elements in different ratios
An atom with the same number of protons but different numbers of neutrons
A molecule with different bonding structures
An ion with a different number of electrons
The Diversity of Matter and Chemical Bon.answer: An atom with the same number of protons but different numbers of neutrons

The Diversity of Matter and Chemical Bon.question: What is the trend for atomic radius across a period from left to right?
Which group of elements has the highest reactivity?
Why are noble gases generally unreactive?
options: Their outer electron shell is full
They are too heavy to react
They form strong bonds with other noble gases
The Diversity of Matter and Chemical Bon.answer: Their outer electron shell is full

The Diversity of Matter and Chemical Bon.question: What is the molecular shape of CH₄ (methane) according to VSEPR theory?
Which of the following molecules exhibits hydrogen bonding?
Why do water molecules have a bent shape instead of a linear shape?
options: The hydrogen atoms are repelled by each other
The oxygen atom has a higher electronegativity
Lone pairs of electrons on oxygen push the hydrogen atoms closer together
Water molecules are attracted to other water molecules
The Diversity of Matter and Chemical Bon.answer: Lone pairs of electrons on oxygen push the hydrogen atoms closer together

The Diversity of Matter and Chemical Bon.question: What is a resonance structure?
options: A molecule that constantly shifts between two different compounds
A molecule with an unequal distribution of electrons
A way of representing a molecule where multiple valid Lewis structures exist
A bond that is both ionic and covalent
The Diversity of Matter and Chemical Bon.answer: A way of representing a molecule where multiple valid Lewis structures exist
